text: Democracy arises out of the notion that those who are equal in any respect are equal in all respects because men are equally free, they claim to be absolutely equal.
author: Aristotle

text: In the affairs of this world, men are saved not by faith, but by the want of it.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Nothing astonishes men so much as common sense and plain dealing.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Bad men are full of repentance.
author: Aristotle

text: Nine men in ten are would be suicides.
author: Benjamin Franklin
